titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Jane Leftwich Curry Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Brad Bauer. Revised by Irena Czernichowska, 2011

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Jane Leftwich Curry Collection)//EN" "curryjan.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Sound recordings and transcripts of interviews, clippings and other printed matter, conference materials, and miscellany, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasting to Poland, the media in Eastern Europe, and political conditions in Poland, Ukraine and Georgia. Sound use copies of sound recordings available.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. Use copies of some sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jane Leftwich Curry collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2002.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Jane Leftwich Curry Collection consists of Sound recordings of interviews of Polish communist political and media officials, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasting to Poland, as well as transcripts of interviews with political figures from Georgia and Ukraine. The Subject Files series includes various clippings and articles reflecting the political and economic scene in Poland before and during 1989 political transition.

Collection also contains reports, memoranda, and statistical data relating to public media in Poland. Of particular interest are surveys and studies conducted by Public Opinion Research Center, documenting the impact of media and propaganda on Polish citizens in the late 1980's through the 1990's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See also: Sound Recordings of Conducted Interviews

did.unittitle: Kakabadze, Gela; Nikolaishvili, Gela; and Zesashvili, Giorgi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes research centres' reports, RFE reports, articles, and conferences papers related to media in Poland, also political parties brochures, newspaper clippings on political and economic conditions in Poland, Zycie Partii journal articles, publications, and a videocassette

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes research centers reports, conferences and studies on media in Poland

"Restructuring of Television in East and Central Europe," paper for the colloquium of Center for Communication and Information Studies,
"Civil Society and Media Democratization in East-Central Europe" paper for the Conference on Civil Society, Political Society, and Democracy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, articles, related to political and economic conditions in Poland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes interviews with Polish communist elites about the role of Radio Free Europe in Poland. 82 compact sound cassettes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The last cassette (parts 3&4), which appears to be from a separate interview on 11 March 2002, is effectively blank.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This interview was recorded at 2x normal cassette speed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The interview is in Polish; Curry includes a brief descriptive voice stamp in English.

did.unittitle: Ramishvili, Levan, and Conquest, Robert, interviews
Conquest, Robert, and Schwartz, Stephen, interviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The audio quality is poor. This is due to the interviews being badly recorded off the telephone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Irma speaks in another language. A translator conducts the interview between Irma and Curry.

did.unittitle: Sobczak, Joanna, and Strzezewski, Michal, interviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This interview is about the impact of Radio Free Europe in Poland and on the government.
